meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site vellicates my ears.
meanings.sent2: The constant buzzing of the mosquito vellicates me during the night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten vellicates the dog's tail, causing a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet vellicates my patience like a dripping drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on my shirt vellicates my skin, making me squirm uncomfortably.

meanings.definition: To tickle or cause a tingling sensation
meanings.sent1: The feather vellicates my nose, making me sneeze uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The gentle touch of the grass vellicates my bare feet as I walk through the field.
meanings.sent3: The playful breeze vellicates the leaves on the tree, creating a rustling melody.
meanings.sent4: The anticipation of the roller coaster ride vellicates my stomach with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The icy water vellicates my skin as I dip my toes into the cold stream.
